qas.question: Which group did Han forces fight in the Tarm Basin?
When was the first national census taken in China?
What was the population of China in 2 AD?
What year was the Protectorate of Western Regions created in?
Which kingdom did the Han conquer in 109 BC?

context: From roughly 115 to 60 BC, Han forces fought <a0_0>the Xiongnu<a0_0/> over control of the oasis city-states in the Tarim Basin. Han was eventually victorious and established the Protectorate of the Western Regions in <a3_0>60 BC<a3_0/>, which dealt with the region's defense and foreign affairs. The Han also expanded southward. The naval conquest of Nanyue in 111 BC expanded the Han realm into what are now modern Guangdong, Guangxi, and northern Vietnam. Yunnan was brought into the Han realm with the conquest of the <a4_0>Dian<a4_0/> Kingdom in 109 BC, followed by parts of the Korean Peninsula with the colonial establishments of Xuantu Commandery and Lelang Commandery in 108 BC. In China's first known nationwide census taken in <a1_0>2 AD<a1_0/>, the population was registered as having <a2_0>57,671,400<a2_0/> individuals in 12,366,470 households.
